data: In the middle of the Irish Sea there is, as every one knows, an island which for many ages has had its own people, with their own language and laws, their own judges and governor, their own lords and kings, their own customs and superstitions, their own proverbs and saws, their own ballads and songs.
She's All the World to Me
browsing: literature|browsing: travel & geography|browsing: fiction|category: novels|category: british literature
